lines:
1956

Imperial medical College

2que may 1911, v

Teuten u. Chinia, 
Alfred G. Stearns Esquire,

Dear Sir. 
26th mist in wherry band letter dated an

have asked your 
Kind assistance to facilitate my son S.S. 
Kwan to return home for a visit immediate 
ofter his examination, and topend his 
summer holiday at home in China. 
I trust, therefore, that you will provide

me with the necessary expenditures from 
The fand I rermitted conne weeks agok 
to direct him to take the shortest and 
Cheapest route in his return. My

is very anxious to see him and 
is her destre will not be accomplished 
Dam afraid, there shall be á grave 
consequence, because she has been 
recovered from serious sicknen. Please 
Conrnce

of this condition 
and oblige. Mitt best wishes from

Yours mat stencerch

noveera

KMwan.
raw: 1956 Imperial medical College 2que may 1911, v Teuten u. Chinia, Alfred G. Stearns Esquire, Dear Sir. 26th mist in wherry band letter dated an have asked your Kind assistance to facilitate my son S.S. Kwan to return home for a visit immediate ofter his examination, and topend his summer holiday at home in China. I trust, therefore, that you will provide me with the necessary expenditures from The fand I rermitted conne weeks agok to direct him to take the shortest and Cheapest route in his return. My is very anxious to see him and is her destre will not be accomplished Dam afraid, there shall be á grave consequence, because she has been recovered from serious sicknen. Please Conrnce of this condition and oblige. Mitt best wishes from Yours mat stencerch noveera KMwan.

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Handwritten letter requesting permission for his son to return to China for the summer, using existing funds, and the shortest and cheapest route for the trip. He states that his wife is eager to see their son, having recovered from a serious illness.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
